chapter.title: Copies
chapter.para: Administration > Copies allows you to customize the cataloguing of copies of works in your library. You can customize media type, statistical code, section, status, location, owner, and finally add customizable fields to your copies.

sect1.title: Media types
sect1.para: Media types allows configuration of the various types of documents and for each one of them the loan period in days.

Warning, we are talking here of types of documents that will be displayed for the copy and not for the bibliographical record. They are defined here to supplement or provide details about the type of document defined for the work. In PMB the medium type for works is normalized in UNIMARC.
Type of document is also used to define Loan period or Duration of hold for an item.

Warning If advanced loans quotas are enabled (parameter type pmb, sub-type advanced-quotas set to 1), the columns Loan period and Duration of hold display See quotas. For more information, refer to and .

Both columns Coding owners and Import coding correspond to the management of data gathered while importing UNIMARC copies, they are used to establish the link with the type of document already defined. For more information, refer to the chapter Definitions.

sect1.title: Statistical codes
sect1.para: The statistical code is used for loan statistics and for the library holdings.

Both columns Coding owners and Import coding correspond to the management of data gathered while importing UNIMARC copies, they are used to establish the link with the type of document already defined. For more information, refer to the chapter Definitions.

sect1.title: Sections
sect1.para: Section is the division of the library to which the document belongs (adult, youth, music ...). This code is taken into account for the calculation of statistics, for example.
Section might also correspond to a geographical area of the library, it can be as large as a room or as small as a shelf.

Both columns Coding owners and Import coding correspond to the management of data gathered while importing UNIMARC copies, they are used to establish a link with a section already defined. See the chapter for more information.

sect1.title: Status
sect1.para: Status is used to specify whether the document can be loaned or not.
Status generally deals with a physical state (damaged, good, lost) or the whereabouts of the book between ordering and loan to readers (on order, in acquisition, in cataloguing, in repairs ...).

Both columns Coding owners and Import coding correspond to the management of data gathered while importing UNIMARC copies, they are used to establish a link with a status already defined. For more information, refer to the chapter Definitions.

sect1.title: Locations
sect1.para: Location can be used to link the document with a specific geographical location (example: in reserve).

This location notion is very important for multi-site libraries. It can also be very useful for specialized documentation centres: research laboratory or company where books can be loaned for a rather long period. These have been taken off the shelves and have been transferred to the design department or the study of a scientist. In this case, PMB can be used to define a location Design department and a corresponding status Reference work, for which the loan would obviously be impossible because the copy is absent from the shelves. This solution allows for the tracing of books required outside of the library without necessitating a loan for a period left undetermined.

Both columns Coding owners and Import coding correspond to the management of data gathered while importing UNIMARC copies, they are used to establish a link with the type of document already defined. For more information, refer to the chapter Definitions.

You can define different parameters for each location. For example, these parameters can be used for overdue letters or the library address. Each time the library address is required, PMB looks for the corresponding value in location.

sect1.title: Owners
sect1.para: You will find here the list of owners of copies managed in the catalogue. You can mention here the collection made available to you by your Departmental Lending Library, a collection bequeathed to the library, a donation that you wish to identify ...

sect1.title: Customizable data
sect1.para: These correspond to your own library information regarding copies. It allows you to specify your management data: source of donation or financing for the acquisition, ...

Example. Let's add a field entitled Type of book cover that will enable us to specify the type of binding of a book. Bindings can be of 3 types: soft, hardback, paperback. Since not all copies correspond to books, we will add another choice: Not Applicable.
Click on New field
The following screen is displayed:

For name of field, enter cover (do not use accents, spaces or punctuation marks in the name for a field), for title to display, enter cover (you can also use a name with spaces but only for display purposes, for example Type of cover).
For type of entry choose List box. Then click on Options.

figure.title: Options for the List box type

sect1.para: Click on Add 4 times to define 4 different choices: paperback, soft, hardback, Not Applicable. The stored values in the database are paperback, soft, hardback and nocover. You will then obtain the result displayed above. Now click on Save to close the popup window, and finally on Save to add your parameter.
You can now use your new customized field for any input or modification of a copy. For more information on the creation of a copy, refer to the PMB User's Guide.
In Cataloguing > record > new record, after creating a new record, you can add a copy. You will then see your new customized field.

figure.title: Editing a copy, the customized field Type of cover has been added

sect2.title: Types of input for customizable fields
sect2.para: Other types of input exist for a customizable field than the list box type.
There are five types of customizable fields:
Each one of these types has 5 different options. Click on Options to specify the parameters for these fields.

sect3.title: Text type
sect3.para: For a text type you can specify its screen size. You can also specify the maximum number of letters to enter (if larger that the specified size on screen, you will still be able to enter even when you reach the end of the input box).

sect3.title: List box type
sect3.para: Warning you cannot create options for the choices until the field has been recorded. From the screen add a parameter, record the customizable field. Then click on its name to modify it and specify options.

figure.title: Options for the List box type

sect3.para: For a list box you can specify:

listitem.para: if it is a multiple choice list (to select multiple choices in a list with your internet browser, you need to click on the choices while holding down the control key.)
the default value. When no choice is made, this is the value that will be displayed.

a list of options, This list includes a label: the text that will be displayed on screen; a value: the value that will be stored in PMB (accents, spaces, punctuation marks ... are not allowed). A sort order for the various options can be specified.

sect3.para: With the action buttons you can:

listitem.para: add an extra choice to the list
delete the choices you have ticked on the checkbox at the beginning of each corresponding line

sect3.title: List box from a query type

figure.title: Options for a List box from a query type

sect3.para: For a List box from a query you can specify:

listitem.para: if it is a multiple choice list (to select multiple choices in a list with you internet browser, you need to click on the choices while holding down the control key.)
the default value. When no choice is made, this is the value that will be displayed
a query that will display the options list.

sect3.para: With the action buttons you can:

listitem.para: test your query. When you click on the button, the choices returned by the query are displayed below the button. This will enable you to check the validity of your query.

sect3.title: Date type
sect3.para: There are no particular options for customizable fields of date type. Clicking on the Options button will only display the message above.

sect3.title: Comment zone type

figure.title: Options for the Comment zone type

sect3.para: Fields of the type Comment zone work the same way as text fields. In addition, you can specify a number of lines for the comment field.

sect2.title: Data types, visible in OPAC, mandatory
sect2.para: Five types of data can be stored in the PMB database: text, large text, integer, date, decimal number.

Visible in OPAC allows to choose if this field will be visible to readers. In this way you can add fields reserved for the library personnel: for example, the name of the person who created the record, ...
Mandatory specifies that the field must be filled in. If the field is not filled in during input or editing of an item, an error message is displayed.

figure.title: Warning for a blank mandatory field
